Description:
Job Purpose (State in one sentence the overall objective of the job)Responsibility of a Project Manager – Quality & Regulatory Affairs is to lead and manage regulatory affairs projects globally, along with the responsibility of overseeing all aspects of project management, from project planning to execution and closure, ensuring successful delivery of projects within scope, on time, and within budget. It also involves working closely with cross-functional teams and external partners to ensure timely and successful execution of regulatory projects.Major Accountabilities (Describe the main results of the job to be achieved)  Lead and manage global QRA projects from initiation to closure, ensuring all projects are delivered within scope, on time and within budget.
Develop and maintain project plans, schedules, and budgets for regulatory affairs projects.
Apply critical thinking to formulate strategies and concepts that drive results, persuade and influence others, adapt to change, and manage conflict
Implement QRA strategies, Through end-to-end regulatory processes, ensuring safe and effective products / solutions are brought to market, on time, and sustained throughout life cycle via compliant, innovative regulatory strategies
Analyzing and scoping the impact including the applicability of new and complex regulatory developments across the assigned business/product/function, including cross-border impact
Coordinate with cross-functional teams including but not limited to regulatory affairs, clinical research, quality assurance, manufacturing, marketing, and legal.
Manage project risks and issues and develop mitigation plans.
Communicate project status, risks, and issues to key stakeholders including senior management, customers, and partners.
Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations, standards, and guidelines.
Provide guidance and support to team members on project management methodologies, tools, and processes.
Participate in the development and implementation of best practices, processes, and procedures related to regulatory affairs project management.
Conduct regular project reviews and lessons learned sessions to continuously improve project management processes and deliverables.
Uses basic project management tools to track and monitor project execution.Alcon is an Equal Opportunity Employer and takes pride in maintaining a diverse environment.
